text.content:
{{> _header}}
 
Dear Dr. %%LastName%%,
 
As the Medical Director of the Lung Center at Cancer Treatment Centers of America(R) (CTCA) in Tulsa, I am focused on how to best fight and treat lung cancer. Studies* have shown that screening high-risk individuals with low-dose CT scans could reduce lung cancer mortality by 20 percent, so I’m pleased to share that the CTCA(R) facility in Tulsa is now offering services for lung cancer screening and diagnosis.

 

The U.S. Preventative Task Force recommends annual screening for lung cancer with a low-dose CT scan for the following patients:
 
  55 to 80 years old
  30+ pack-year smoking history
  Currently smoke or have quit within the past 15 years 

Our program offers:
 
  Quick Appointments – Patients are typically seen the same week they call for an appointment.
  Rapid Results – Screening results are delivered to you and your patient quickly, often within 48 hours.
  Access to Specialists – If your patient needs additional follow-up, CTCA offers quick access to a multidisciplinary team of board-certified interventional radiologists and pulmonologists as well as thoracic surgeons to diagnose and manage any aspect of thoracic malignancy.
  Patient Follow-up – Our screening software system helps ensure patients don’t miss crucial follow-up appointments and that you are notified of the latest with their care.
 
Please find a lung cancer screening guideline poster that a few of your colleagues requested to share with patients here
https://www.cancercenter.com/~/media/Collateral%20Vault/Posters/3769_Lung_Cancer_Screening_Guidelines_Vault.pdf
.
 
Additionally, if you have questions or would like us to evaluate one of your patients, you may contact me at (918)286-5900. Or if you need to reach me during patient hours, please contact our Referral Team at (918)286-5900 or ok-referrals@ctca-hope.com
mailto:ok-referrals@ctca-hope.com?subject=Lung%20cancer%20screening%20request
.

 
%%=ContentBlockbyID("21224")=%%
 
*The National Lung Cancer Screening Trial. Reduced Lung Cancer Mortality with Low-Dose Computed Tomographic Screening. NEJM, 2011; 365(5):395-409
 
https://www.cancercenter.com/
 
Daniel Nader, DO, FCCP, FACP

  Medical Director, CTCA Tulsa Lung Center
https://www.cancercenter.com/southwestern/lung-cancer-center/
 
  CTCA Comprehensive Care and Research Center – Tulsa
https://www.cancercenter.com/southwestern/
(R)
 
O: (918) 286-5900 

   E: D.Nader@ctca-hope.com 

   W: cancercenter.com
